messages.content: What is the first word in brothers Grimm version of Red Riding hood

The Brothers Grimm's version of "Little Red Riding Hood," also known as "Little Red Cap," typically begins with an introduction of the beloved little girl [ebsco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). While variations exist, common opening lines include "Once upon a time there was a sweet little girl" [grimmstories](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2), "THERE was once a sweet little maiden, who was loved by all who knew her" [wikisource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3), "Once upon a time there lived in a certain village a little country girl, the prettiest creature who was ever seen" [pitt](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4), "THERE WAS once a sweet little maid, much beloved by everybody, but most of all by her grandmother, who never knew how to make enough of her" [pinkmonkey](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5), and "Once upon a time there was a dear little girl who was loved by everyone who looked at her" [exeternorthcott](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). Therefore, the first word is often either "Once" or "THERE" depending on the specific translation.

search_query: first word "Little Red Riding Hood" Brothers Grimm
web_research_result:
The Brothers Grimm's version of "Little Red Riding Hood," also known as "Little Red Cap," typically begins with an introduction of the beloved little girl [ebsco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [exeternorthcott](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). The first sentence often describes her and her special connection with her grandmother [ebsco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).

Here are a few variations of the opening lines from different sources:

*   "Once upon a time there was a sweet little girl" [grimmstories](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).
*   "THERE was once a sweet little maiden, who was loved by all who knew her" [wikisource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).
*   "Once upon a time there lived in a certain village a little country girl, the prettiest creature who was ever seen" [pitt](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).
*   "THERE WAS once a sweet little maid, much beloved by everybody, but most of all by her grandmother, who never knew how to make enough of her" [pinkmonkey](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5).
*   "Once upon a time there was a dear little girl who was loved by everyone who looked at her" [exeternorthcott](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).

These opening lines set the stage for the classic fairy tale about a young girl's encounter with a wolf [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) [ebsco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). The story carries different names and has evolved through various versions and interpretations over the centuries [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6).
